page.title: 16 Religion in Keith
page.content: There are 4 churches in the town of Keith.These are the North Church,St. Rufus' Church,St. Thomas' Roman Catholic Church and the Scottish Episcopal Church.St. Rufus' Church is in Church Road and the minister is the Rev. Mcleod.Inside the church are the rows of wooden seats where the people sit during the service.A staircase leads up to the balcony where there are more seats.The pulpit from which the minister preaches is in an elevated position at the front of the church. Church services are held every Sunday in the morning and evening.There is also Sunday School and Bible Classes for the children. St.Thomas's Chapel stands at the top of Chapel Street and is easily identifiable by its large greenish coloured dome made from copper.This church is used only by Roman Catholics.
